Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Duration \Du*ra"tion\, n. [OF. duration. See {Dure}.] The state or quality of lasting; continuance in time; the portion of time during which anything exists. [1913 Webster]
It was proposed that the duration of Parliament should be limited. --Macaulay. [1913 Webster]
Soon shall have passed our own human duration. --D. Webster. [1913 Webster]

duration n 1: the period of time during which something continues [syn: {continuance}] 2: the property of enduring or continuing in time [syn: {continuance}] 3: continuance in time; "the ceremony was of short duration"; "he complained about the length of time required" [syn: {length}]
